alert.note: Alert for Crook County Plains; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains; Wyoming Black Hills (Wyoming) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS RapidCity (Western South Dakota and Northeastern Wyoming)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued August 01 at 2:46PM MDT until August 01 at 9:00PM MDT by NWS RapidCity
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING IN EFFECT TODAY FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, 318, 322, 327, AND 329... .Hot temperatures, very dry air, and breezy northwest winds will continue into early evening over northeast Wyoming, as well as parts of the far western South Dakota plains. Minimum relative humidities of 8-15 percent combined with gusty northwest winds will continue to create critical fire weather conditions. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR GUSTY WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR FIRE WEATHER ZONES 314, 315, 316, 317, AND 318... * AFFECTED AREA...Fire Weather Zones 314 Northern Campbell, 315 Southern Campbell, 316 Crook County Plains, 317 Weston County Plains and 318 Wyoming Black Hills. * WINDS...Northwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 30 mph. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...As low as 10 percent. * IMPACTS...The combination of gusty winds and low relative humidity will produce critical fire weather conditions.
info.instruction: A red flag warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now, or will shortly. A combination of strong winds, low relative humidity, and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.

area.areaDesc: Crook County Plains; Northern Campbell; Southern Campbell; Weston County Plains; Wyoming Black Hills
